Premise: If the sun shines tomorrow, then we will go to the beach.
If it rains tomorrow, then we will go to the museum.
Tomorrow the sun will shine, or it will rain.
Hypothesis: Therefore tomorrow we will go to the museum or to the beach.
Label: True

Premise: If I have 1 million dollars, I will donate half of it.
If I have 10 million dollars, I will donate 75% of it.
Either I have 1 million dollars or 10 million dollars.
Hypothesis: Therefore I will donate 500 thousand dollars or 7.5 million dollars.
Label: True

Premise: If I am working out, I am happy.
If I am sleeping, I am dreaming.
Either I am working out or sleeping.
Hypothesis: Therefore I am not happy or I am not dreaming.
Label: False

Premise: If it rains, roads will be muddy
If it snows, roads will be slippery
Either it is raining or it is snowy
Hypothesis: Therefore, roads are not either muddy, or roads are slippery.
Label: False

Premise: If you take Logic, you will have to do a lot of homework
If you take Philosophy, you will have to write a lot of papers.
Since you take either Logic or Philosophy.
Hypothesis: Therefore, you will have to do a lot of homework and write a lot of papers.
Label: Undetermined
